resources.string: Study is running, thank you for participating!
WHALE needs to be registered as an accessibility service in order to read the logical composition of what\'s on your screen.
Study is paused and will resume tomorrow
Everything has been set up, you can now proceed and start your participation in the study.
Doing some work in the background.
Study has ended. Thank you for participating!
Point your camera at the QR code
If you wish to request data deletion, you can do so after cancelling your participation.
Are you sure you want to cancel your participation in the study?\n\nIf you wish to have your data deleted, you can request it through the study settings after cancelling.
To request an export of your study data, please send an email with your enrolment ID: %1$s.\n\n
Do you want to proceed and open your email client?
To request the deletion of your study data, please send an email with your enrolment ID: %1$s.\n\n

Hello,

I would like to request the deletion of my study data.
My enrolment ID is: %1$s

Thank you.

Hello,

I would like to request an export of my study data.
My enrolment ID is: %1$s

Thank you.
FAQ information is not available for this study.
Data protection notice is not available.
Participation has been cancelled. You can uninstall the app now.
The study has ended. You may need to fill out the last questionnaire before uninstalling the app.
Complete them as soon as possible
We can enter some text here to explain the app and so on and so on

Our WHALE research app collects data for 13 days that is not based on self-reported information, but on information from sensors in your smartphone. This includes, for example, ambient noise or how often you communicate with others via apps and/or phone calls. WHALE does not store ambient noise, but merely categorizes it (e.g., “speech,” “music,” “dog barking”) and then deletes it.
WHALE does not record which messages you post or view on social media, but merely measures that you have used this social media platform. Phone calls are not recorded and phone numbers are not recognized, but it is merely registered that you have made a call.

This smartphone data can provide important additional information about your everyday environment for the study. For example, this data helps us understand the context in which you answered the questionnaires without having to ask you specifically about it.
A detailed list of the types of data collected can be found in the privacy policy and consent form you received when you registered for the study.
Please accept all permissions to start the study.
Finalizing setup, this may take a while...
Your answers were saved. Thank you!
No questions have been provided. This is likely a mistake of the study creator.
No data protection notice was filled for this study.
I have read and accept the data protection notice.
Please enter a value between %1$d and %2$d.
This is technically necessary to prevent your smartphone from automatically closing the WHALE app and to ensure that information from your smartphone\'s sensors can be recorded continuously.

Uses the microphone to make short audio recordings that are converted into a category within the app (e.g., “speech,” “music,” “dog barking,” “street noise”).
Note: The audio recording itself will be deleted. This means that no audio recordings will be sent to our server. For more detailed information on how we process your audio recordings in a privacy-friendly manner, please refer to the privacy policy and consent form you received when you registered for the study.

Detects which Wi-Fi network you are logged into and which Wi-Fi networks are in your vicinity. However, we do not store the name of the network, but rather an encrypted version that does not allow any conclusions to be drawn about the name.
Automatically starts WHALE after a device restart
Detects whether you are on a call. We do not store call content.
Technically necessary to enable Wi-Fi status detection. See above.
Allows WHALE to continue running even when you don\'t have the app open. Your smartphone will always show you that the app is active.

This permission is required by the system because the app detects your Wi-Fi and Bluetooth status, which could potentially reveal your location. However, since the app does not store any names (see above), but rather an encrypted version, it is not possible to determine your location. We do not store any location data.
Note: Select Allow always

This permission is required by the system so that Wi-Fi and Bluetooth status can be detected even when you do not have the app open. The app does not record your location in the background, but rather the encrypted names (see above).

Detects which devices in your vicinity have Bluetooth enabled. However, we do not store the name of the device, but rather an encrypted version that does not allow any conclusions to be drawn about the name.
Allows WHALE to send you notifications within the app to inform you about questionnaires and study updates.
Recognizes physical activities like walking or running
Schedules timely data collection and sending of questionnaires and allows the app to run at the scheduled time

Displays questionnaire windows in the foreground
Note: Scroll to WHALE app settings

Detects when notifications are received from which app
Note: If your smartphone does not allow notification access, you will be redirected to the settings. Search for "Apps" and select the \'WHALE\' app under "Apps," scroll to "Allow restricted settings" and enable it. You can then grant permission in the app. Don\'t worry, you can trust us. We do not store phone numbers or plain text content from notifications, only that you received a notification and from which app.

Detects which buttons or menus you click on while using an app, the layout of the app you are using, and the screen interaction (tap, swipe, etc.) you perform.
Note: Click on “Downloaded apps” and select “WHALE.” Please note: The information panel on your smartphone may list significantly more permissions than those that the WHALE app actually accesses according to its privacy policy.

Detects which app you are using and for how long, when you have turned on the screen of your smartphone
Note: You will be redirected to the “Access to usage data” setting. Swipe to the bottom until you see the ‘WHALE’ app. Tap on “WHALE” and allow usage tracking. The information panel on your smartphone may list significantly more permissions than those that the WHALE app actually accesses according to its privacy policy.

Prevents your smartphone from terminating the WHALE app to save battery power. Allows information from your smartphone\'s sensors to be recorded continuously.
Note: Select "no restrictions".
Information from sensors in your smartphone
Alerts when required permissions are revoked

plurals.name: permission_revoked_notification_text
plurals.item: %d permission was revoked. Tap to re-enable.
%d permissions were revoked. Tap to re-enable.

resources.string: Some required permissions were revoked. Please re-enable them to continue participating in the study.
All permissions granted again. Thank you!
Some required permissions were revoked. The study cannot collect data properly.
Not all data has been uploaded yet. Please upload all items before uninstalling the app.
Your data upload has been scheduled and will start soon.
Your data is currently being uploaded to the server.
All data has been successfully uploaded.
The data upload encountered an error. Please try again.
Please open the app to synchronize your data to the server.
The last data upload has not been uploaded for two days. Please start an upload now. The upload will be done regardless how you\'re connected, so costs can occur if you\'re on mobile data.
